active_person_count.description_html: The total number of users that used ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} resources.
active_person_count.name: Number of Users: Active

active_pi_count.description_html: The total number of PIs that used ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} resources.
active_pi_count.name: Number of PIs: Active

active_resource_count.description_html: The total number of active ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} resources.
active_resource_count.name: Number of Resources: Active

avg_cpu_hours.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.cpu_time) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0) / 3600.0
avg_cpu_hours.description_html:
The average CPU hours (number of CPU cores x wall time hours) per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
For each job, the CPU usage is aggregated. For example, if a job used 1000 CPUs for one minute, it would be aggregated as 1000 CPU minutes or 16.67 CPU hours.
avg_cpu_hours.name: CPU Hours: Per Job

avg_gpu_hours.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.gpu_time) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0) / 3600.0
avg_gpu_hours.description_html:
The average GPU hours (number of GPU cores x wall time hours) per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
For each job, the GPU usage is aggregated. For example, if a job used 1000 GPUs for one minute, it would be aggregated as 1000 GPU minutes or 16.67 GPU hours.
avg_gpu_hours.name: GPU Hours: Per Job

avg_job_size_weighted_by_cpu_hours.description_html:
The average ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job size weighted by CPU Hours. Defined as
Average Job Size Weighted By CPU Hours: sum(i = 0 to n){ job i core count * job i cpu hours}/sum(i = 0 to n){job i cpu hours}
avg_job_size_weighted_by_cpu_hours.name: Job Size: Weighted By CPU Hours

avg_job_size_weighted_by_gpu_hours.description_html:
The average ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job size weighted by GPU Hours. Defined as
Average Job Size Weighted By GPU Hours: sum(i = 0 to n){ job i core count * job i gpu hours}/sum(i = 0 to n){job i gpu hours}
avg_job_size_weighted_by_gpu_hours.name: Job Size: Weighted By GPU Hours

avg_node_hours.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.node_time) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0) / 3600.0
avg_node_hours.description_html: The average node hours (number of nodes x wall time hours) per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
avg_node_hours.name: Node Hours: Per Job

avg_processors.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.processor_count * CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0)
avg_processors.description_html:
The average job size per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
Job Size: The number of processor cores used by a (parallel) job.
avg_processors.name: Job Size: Per Job

avg_gpus.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.gpu_count * CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0)
avg_gpus.description_html:
The average job size per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
Job Size: The number of GPUs used by a (parallel) job.
avg_gpus.name: GPU Count: Per Job

avg_waitduration_hours.description_html:
The average time, in hours, a ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job waits before execution on the designated resource.
Wait Time: Wait time is defined as the linear time between submission of a job by a user until it begins to execute.
avg_waitduration_hours.name: Wait Hours: Per Job

avg_wallduration_hours.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(agg.wallduration)/SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END),0)/3600.0
avg_wallduration_hours.description_html:
The average time, in hours, a job takes to execute.
In timeseries view mode, the statistic shows the average wall time per job per time period. In aggregate view mode the statistic only includes the job wall hours between the defined time range. The wall hours outside the time range are not included in the calculation.
Wall Time: Wall time is defined as the linear time between start and end time of execution for a particular job.
avg_wallduration_hours.name: Wall Hours: Per Job

expansion_factor.description_html:
The average job size per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
Job Size: The number of processor cores used by a (parallel) job.
expansion_factor.name: User Expansion Factor

job_count.description_html: The total number of ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} jobs that ended within the selected duration.
job_count.name: Number of Jobs Ended

max_processors.description_html:
The maximum size ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job in number of cores.
Job Size: The total number of processor cores used by a (parallel) job.
max_processors.formula: COALESCE( MAX( CASE WHEN agg.processor_count = 0 THEN NULL ELSE agg.processor_count END), 0)
max_processors.name: Job Size: Max

min_processors.description_html:
The minimum size ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job in number of cores.
Job Size: The total number of processor cores used by a (parallel) job.
min_processors.formula: COALESCE( MIN( CASE WHEN agg.processor_count = 0 THEN NULL ELSE agg.processor_count END), 0)
min_processors.name: Job Size: Min

normalized_avg_processors.description_html:
The average size ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job divided by the total number of cores in the resource where the job ran. The job normalization calculation assumes that the resource size is constant. This statistic should not be used with a time range where the resource size changes, because the statistic will be incorrect.
Normalized Job Size: The ratio of the total number of processor cores used by a (parallel) job over the total number of cores on the resource.
normalized_avg_processors.name: Job Size: Normalized

running_job_count.#: Support different formulas for aggregate and timeseries queries
running_job_count.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.running_job_count ELSE agg.started_job_count END), 0)
running_job_count.description_html: The total number of ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} jobs that are running.
running_job_count.name: Number of Jobs Running

sem_avg_cpu_hours.description_html:
The average CPU hours (number of CPU cores x wall time hours) per ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
For each job, the CPU usage is aggregated. For example, if a job used 1000 CPUs for one minute, it would be aggregated as 1000 CPU minutes or 16.67 CPU hours.

sem_avg_node_hours.description_html:
The standard error of the average node hours by each ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job.
Std Err of the Avg: The standard deviation of the sample mean, estimated by the sample estimate of the population standard deviation (sample standard deviation) divided by the square root of the sample size (assuming statistical independence of the values in the sample).
sem_avg_node_hours.name: Std Dev: Node Hours: Per Job

sem_avg_processors.description_html:
The standard error of the average size ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job in number of cores.
Std Err of the Avg: The standard deviation of the sample mean, estimated by the sample estimate of the population standard deviation (sample standard deviation) divided by the square root of the sample size (assuming statistical independence of the values in the sample).
sem_avg_processors.name: Std Dev: Job Size: Per Job

sem_avg_gpus.description_html:
The standard error of the number of GPUs.
Std Err of the Avg: The standard deviation of the sample mean, estimated by the sample estimate of the population standard deviation (sample standard deviation) divided by the square root of the sample size (assuming statistical independence of the values in the sample).
sem_avg_gpus.name: Std Dev: GPU Count: Per Job

sem_avg_waitduration_hours.description_html:
The standard error of the average time, in hours, an ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job had to wait until it began to execute.
Std Err of the Avg: The standard deviation of the sample mean, estimated by the sample estimate of the population standard deviation (sample standard deviation) divided by the square root of the sample size (assuming statistical independence of the values in the sample).
sem_avg_waitduration_hours.name: Std Dev: Wait Hours: Per Job

sem_avg_wallduration_hours.description_html:
The standard error of the average time each ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} job took to execute.
Std Err of the Avg: The standard deviation of the sample mean, estimated by the sample estimate of the population standard deviation (sample standard deviation) divided by the square root of the sample size (assuming statistical independence of the values in the sample).
sem_avg_wallduration_hours.name: Std Dev: Wall Hours: Per Job

utilization.aggregate_formula: COALESCE((SUM(agg.cpu_time) / (SELECT SUM(rsa.allocated_cpu_core_time) FROM modw_aggregates.resourcespecsfact_by_${AGGREGATION_UNIT} AS rsa WHERE rsa.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id BETWEEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} AND ${MAX_DATE_ID} AND FIND_IN_SET(rsa.record_resource_id, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT agg.task_resource_id)) <> 0)) * 100, 0)
utilization.description_html:
The percentage of core time that a resource has been running jobs.
${ORGANIZATION_NAME} Utilization: The ratio of the total CPU hours consumed by jobs over a given time period divided by the maximum CPU hours that the system could deliver (based on the number of cores present on the resource and the percent of the resource allocated through ${ORGANIZATION_NAME}). This value does not take into account downtimes or outages. It is just calculated based on the number of cores in the resource specifications.
utilization.name: ${ORGANIZATION_NAME} Utilization
utilization.timeseries_formula: COALESCE((SUM(agg.cpu_time) / (SELECT SUM(rsa.allocated_cpu_core_time) FROM modw_aggregates.resourcespecsfact_by_${AGGREGATION_UNIT} AS rsa WHERE rsa.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id = agg.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id AND FIND_IN_SET(rsa.record_resource_id, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT agg.task_resource_id)) <> 0)) * 100, 0)
